definitions: confident, arrogant way of walking or behaving
display of boldness or arrogance in manner or conduct
examples: He walked with a swagger after winning the championship
The cowboy entered the saloon with his typical swagger
His swagger annoyed everyone at the meeting yesterday
She tried to hide her nervousness with false swagger

definitions: young man who is a lover or suitor, especially in poetry
young man from the countryside or rural areas
examples: The maiden waited patiently for her swain to return
In the poem, the swain courted her with flowers
The young swain helped with the harvest every autumn
Several swains gathered at the village dance on Saturday

definitions: butterfly with elongated hindwing extensions resembling a swallow's tail
formal coat with two long tapering sections at the back
examples: The yellow swallowtail butterfly landed on the flower garden
We spotted several swallowtails during our nature walk yesterday
He wore a swallowtail coat to the formal dinner
The orchestra conductor's swallowtail moved gracefully as he conducted

definitions: Hindu religious teacher or mystic, often used as title of respect
spiritual teacher or leader who provides guidance on religious matters
examples: The swami taught meditation techniques at the ashram daily
Many students traveled far to study with the swami
She consulted the swami about her spiritual journey ahead
The famous swami wrote several books on Hindu philosophy

definitions: area of low-lying land saturated with water and vegetation
situation or condition of being overwhelmed with too much
examples: Alligators live in the swamp near the river delta
The swamp was filled with cypress trees and Spanish moss
The office was in a swamp of paperwork today
Don't let yourself get into a swamp of debt

definitions: low-lying area of land that is permanently saturated with water
examples: They drained the swampland to build new houses there
The swampland provides habitat for many endangered bird species

definitions: large white water bird with long curved neck
person who moves or behaves with exceptional grace and elegance
examples: The swan glided across the lake with perfect grace
A pair of swans nested near the pond every spring
She moved like a swan across the dance floor
The ballet dancer was a true swan in motion

definitions: showy display of wealth or expensive taste meant to impress
expensive and fashionable style or appearance of something luxurious
examples: His swank annoyed everyone at the country club meeting
She couldn't resist a bit of swank at parties
The hotel's swank impressed even the wealthiest guests there
They lived in swank but had very little savings

definitions: act of exchanging one thing for another between parties
examples: Let's make a swap of our baseball cards today
The swap meet happens every Sunday morning at dawn

definitions: large group of insects flying or moving together, especially bees
large number of people or things moving together in group
examples: A swarm of bees settled on the apple tree
The swarm moved as one dark cloud across the sky
A swarm of tourists descended on the small village
The swarm of reporters surrounded the celebrity's car immediately

definitions: sound or movement of water splashing or washing around
swaggering or dashing manner of behaving with bold confidence
examples: The swash of waves against the boat was soothing
We heard the swash of water in the cave
He moved with the swash of an old pirate
Her swash impressed everyone at the costume party yesterday

definitions: daring soldier, adventurer, or fighter who acts with flamboyant courage
character in adventure stories known for swordfighting and bold action
examples: The swashbuckler rescued the princess from the tower prison
He fancied himself a modern swashbuckler in business deals
The movie featured a swashbuckler fighting against evil pirates
Children loved stories about the brave swashbuckler and adventures

definitions: characteristic of daring adventure with flamboyant action and swordplay
examples: His swashbuckling approach to business made him famous worldwide
The swashbuckling hero leaped from the castle wall bravely

definitions: ancient symbol of crossed lines used in many cultures for millennia
symbol appropriated by Nazi Germany as emblem of hate and fascism
examples: The swastika appears in ancient Hindu and Buddhist art everywhere
Archaeologists found a swastika on pottery from 3000 BCE
The Nazi swastika became a symbol of hatred and genocide
Many countries banned display of the swastika after WWII

definitions: sharp slapping blow or hit with hand or object
special weapons and tactics team of trained police officers
examples: She gave the fly a swat with the newspaper
One swat was enough to kill the mosquito instantly
The SWAT team arrived to handle the hostage situation
He joined the SWAT unit after years of training

definitions: small sample piece of fabric or material for testing
examples: She collected swatches before choosing the curtain fabric carefully
The designer showed us swatches of different carpet colors

definitions: strip of grass or crops cut by scythe or mower
broad strip or area of something extending across space
examples: The mower left a wide swath through the tall grass
Each swath of hay dried quickly in the sun
The tornado cut a swath of destruction through town
A swath of sunlight illuminated the dusty library floor

definitions: bandage or cloth wrapped around something for protection or support
something that wraps, covers, or envelops completely like a blanket
examples: The nurse applied a swathe around the injured ankle
Ancient mummies were wrapped in swathes of linen cloth
A swathe of fog covered the valley every morning
She was wrapped in a swathe of warm blankets

definitions: gentle swinging movement from side to side in rhythm
power to influence or control people's actions or opinions
examples: The sway of palm trees was hypnotic to watch
The boat's gentle sway made everyone feel sleepy quickly
His sway over the committee was absolute and unquestioned
The politician lost her sway with younger voters recently

definitions: act of making a solemn promise or taking an oath
use of offensive or profane language to express strong emotion
examples: The swearing in ceremony took place at noon today
Swearing on the Bible is common in many courtrooms
His constant swearing offended everyone in the office building
The coach banned swearing during practice sessions this season

definitions: knitted garment worn on upper body for warmth, pulled over head
examples: She wore a wool sweater to stay warm outside
His grandmother knitted him a sweater every Christmas season

definitions: process of secreting moisture through skin pores to cool body
examples: Sweating helps regulate body temperature during hot weather conditions
The sweating increased as he ran up the hill

definitions: loose warm garment made of soft fabric worn for casual comfort
examples: He wore his college sweatshirt to the football game
The sweatshirt kept her warm during the morning jog

definitions: factory or workshop with very poor conditions and low wages for workers
examples: The sweatshop employed children for twelve hours every day
Investigators discovered a sweatshop hidden in the warehouse basement

definitions: round root vegetable with yellow flesh, also called rutabaga
person from Sweden or of Swedish descent and nationality
examples: She added swede to the winter vegetable soup recipe
The farmer harvested swedes from the field in October
The Swede taught us how to make traditional meatballs
My neighbor is a Swede who moved here recently

definitions: person whose job involves sweeping floors and keeping areas clean
machine or device designed for sweeping floors or surfaces clean
examples: The street sweeper started work before dawn every day
She worked as a sweeper at the factory for years
The carpet sweeper picked up pet hair very effectively
He bought a new sweeper for the warehouse floor

definitions: action of cleaning by brushing away dirt with broom
having broad, comprehensive, or far-reaching effect or scope
examples: The sweeping took her an hour to finish completely
Daily sweeping keeps the shop floor clean and safe
The sweeping changes affected every department in the company
His sweeping statement angered many people at the meeting

definitions: substance used to make food or drink taste sweet
something added to make an offer or deal more attractive
examples: She used artificial sweetener in her coffee every morning
The recipe calls for honey as a natural sweetener
They added a sweetener to close the business deal
The signing bonus was a sweetener for new employees

definitions: gradual increase in size, volume, or intensity of something
long rolling wave or waves in open sea without breaking
examples: The swell in her ankle indicated a serious sprain
We noticed a swell in customer complaints last month
The ocean swell made the boat rock back and forth
Surfers waited patiently for the perfect swell to arrive

definitions: abnormal enlargement of body part caused by injury or disease
examples: The swelling in his knee required immediate medical attention
Ice helps reduce swelling after an injury occurs quickly

definitions: sudden change in direction or course while moving forward
examples: The car's swerve avoided hitting the deer completely
His last-minute swerve prevented a serious accident from happening

definitions: small bird with long wings that flies very fast
examples: The swift caught insects while flying through the air
Swifts migrate thousands of miles to warmer climates annually

definitions: person who swims, especially as sport or for exercise
examples: The swimmer completed fifty laps in the pool today
She's been a competitive swimmer since age six

definitions: activity of moving through water using arms and legs
examples: Swimming is excellent exercise for the whole body system
The swimming lesson helped children overcome their fear of water

definitions: garment worn for swimming or sunbathing at beach or pool
examples: She bought a new swimsuit for the vacation trip
His swimsuit dried quickly in the hot summer sun

definitions: clothing designed to be worn while swimming or at beach
examples: The store's swimwear section offered many different styles available
Designer swimwear can be quite expensive at luxury shops

definitions: fraudulent scheme or action to cheat someone out of money
examples: The swindle cost investors millions of dollars in losses
Police uncovered a swindle targeting elderly homeowners in town

definitions: person who uses deception to deprive someone of money or possessions
examples: The swindler convinced them to invest in fake company
A clever swindler can appear very trustworthy and legitimate initially

definitions: pigs collectively, especially when raised as farm livestock
contemptible or disgusting person who behaves badly toward others
examples: The farmer raised swine for the local meat market
Swine require special care during the cold winter months
He called his former partner a swine after betrayal
Only a swine would steal from a charity organization

definitions: person or thing that swings back and forth regularly
person who participates in swapping romantic partners with others
examples: The trapeze swinger performed amazing aerial stunts every night
As a swing swinger, she loved playground equipment very much
The swingers met at private clubs on weekend nights
They discovered their neighbors were swingers at the party

definitions: movement back and forth or from side to side
exciting and fashionable lifestyle associated with freedom and fun
examples: The swinging of the pendulum was perfectly regular always
Children love the swinging motion of playground swings outdoors
The swinging sixties brought major social changes to society
London had a swinging scene in the 1960s era

definitions: sweeping stroke or blow with hand or object
sliding motion of card through electronic reader for payment
examples: The cat took a swipe at the dangling string
One swipe of the cloth cleaned the entire surface
A quick swipe of her card completed the purchase
The swipe didn't work so she inserted the chip

definitions: whirling or spinning movement of liquid, gas, or objects
pattern of spiraling curves or circular motion in design
examples: The swirl of cream in coffee looked beautiful today
Leaves caught in a swirl of wind danced around
The marble cake had a chocolate swirl throughout it
Her dress featured a swirl of bright colors everywhere

definitions: soft rustling or hissing sound made by movement
smooth, elegant movement or manner of moving gracefully
examples: The swish of her silk dress filled the quiet room
We heard the swish of skis on fresh snow
She moved with a swish that commanded attention everywhere
The horse's tail moved in an elegant swish pattern

definitions: knife with blade that springs out from handle when button pressed
examples: The switchblade opened with a quick click of button
Many places ban carrying switchblades due to safety concerns

definitions: panel with switches for connecting multiple telephone lines in system
examples: The hotel switchboard handled hundreds of calls every day
She worked as a switchboard operator for twenty years

definitions: person who changes or switches between different things regularly
device that switches between multiple inputs or channels electronically
examples: As a job switcher, he never stayed anywhere long
The channel switcher moved between networks looking for news
The video switcher allowed seamless transitions between cameras instantly
We need a new switcher for the studio equipment

definitions: act of changing from one thing, system, or method to another
process of moving trains from one track to another track
examples: The switching between tasks reduced his overall productivity significantly
Switching to renewable energy will take several years completely
The switching of trains requires careful coordination and timing
Railroad switching prevents collisions on busy track systems daily
